headline.main: NASSAU RESTAURANTS FACING STRICT LIMITS ON DINERS' SMOKING

docs.section_name: Front Page; New York and Region

byline.original: By CLIFFORD D. MAY, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Nassau County today adopted a new public antismoking regulation that would be among the strictest in the country. The measure would require that restaurants set aside at least half their seating for nonsmokers. Alternatively, restaurants could install sophisticated air-purifying and ventilating devices and then set aside a quarter of their seats for nonsmokers. #4,000 Establishments Affected There are about 4,000 ''eating and drinking establishments'' in Nassau County. All of them, with the exception of catering companies and bars that do not serve food, would be affected.
